The Need of Study and Means.--A few faithful workers have been trying to do something in this great, wicked city [NEW YORK]. [SEE ALSO PP. 384-389, "NEW YORK."] But their work has been difficult, because they have had so few facilities. Elder ----- and his wife have labored faithfully. But who 
                                                                           37
has felt the burden of sustaining them in their labors? Who among our leading men have visited them, to learn the needs of the work?--General Conference Bulletin, April 7, 1903.
